results.title: The Marco Polo: Queen of the seas
results.creator_credit: Sam Grana, ONF | NFB and Roger Hart
results.brief_description: For lovers of ships, particularly the golden age of sailing ships, “The Marco Polo: Queen of the seas” is a fascinating documentary. The ship began its career as a timber freight carrier but became a passenger ship which carried emigrants to Australia. Produced by the acclaimed National Film Board of Canada, this program uses archival footage and dramatisations to recreate the era.

results.title: The Marble
results.brief_description: A boy of eight possesses a wonderful marble which has magical powers. With it he is powerful, but he loses it down a sewer. The marble passes from person to person until the boy finally retrieves it.

results.title: The Maple Leaf Forever
results.brief_description: On the 50th anniversary of the Battle of Queenstown Heights, October 1867, the people of Canada were invited by a newspaper in the capital to submit poetry songs to commemorate that historical event. This film recreates in live action an event in which a town schoolteacher was encouraged to enter a poem in the contest, he did so and the result became the popular Canadian song “The Maple Leaf Forever”.

results.title: The Maori today
results.brief_description: Covers the opportunities open to Maori citizens of New Zealand and their gradual integration into the general community. The Maori heritage of language, music, tribal culture and art, especially woodcarving, is highly valued by both Maori and pakeha.

results.title: The Many faces of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Yeng Chung-Fan, Keta Communications and Lee Dong-Ming
results.brief_description: A documentary revealing the true spirit of Taiwan. It takes the audience on an exciting excursion to six major scenic and cultural spots in Taiwan including a visit to Orchid Island, participating in the age-old aboriginal rites of the Yami tribe and Taiwan’s natural wonder, Taroko Gorge. We also visit the ancient city of Tainan, bustling Kaohsiung city, and the country’s largest city Taipei. In addition to being an exciting visual experience, it is also a musical treat, with scores written especially by composer Gerald Shih.

results.title: The Many faces of epilepsy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Epilepsy affects 3% of the Australian population and manifests itself in many different ways to individuals, families and communities. Epilepsy sufferers and their families discuss the symptoms they experience (varying from stumbling, absent seizures, tonic clonic), the success/failure and side effects of medication, reaction to diagnosis, what it feels like to have a seizure (daydreaming, contortion, deja vu), how the symptoms change with age, warning signs, the impact on employment and relationships, disclosure and impact on lifestyle.

results.title: The Many adventures of Winnie the Pooh
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney Pictures and John Lounsbery
results.brief_description: This compendium of animated shorts features three stories: “Winnie the Pooh and the honey tree”. Anytime is the right time for honey, according to Pooh. This film follows him through a series of misadventures brought about by his fondness for sweet treats, showing how Pooh gets himself into - and out of - several sticky situations. In “Winnie the Pooh and the blustery day”, Pooh visits his Thoughtful Spot and then, because of the wind, joins in some antics with Piglet. In “Winnie the Pooh and Tigger too” Rabbit, Pooh, and Piglet plan to unbounce Tigger, but discover they like a bouncy Tigger best. Features the voices of Sterling Holloway, Paul Winchell, Sebastian Cabot and others.

results.title: The Manufacture of gas
results.brief_description: A description of gas manufacture showing all stages from the raw material, coal, to the storage of finished product in gas-holders. Shows also the extraction of by-products such as coke, tar, benzol, dyes and disinfectants. The film stresses the economy of gas manufacture compared with the burning of coal in fireplaces or the generation of electricity using coal as raw material.

results.title: The Manton plan
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Sherry James
results.brief_description: Shows how a local municipality goes about establishing a “Disaster Plan”, and putting the plan into operation when a bus crashes on the outskirts of the town and all services are brought into action.

results.title: The Manhattan odyssey
results.creator_credit: Francois Seguillon, ONF | NFB and Bernard Gosselin
results.brief_description: The epic voyage of the giant American oil tanker, the U.S.S. Manhattan, and the Canadian icebreaker, the John A. Macdonald, through the Northwest passage of the Canadian Arctic to test its navigability as a year-round commercial sea lane. Filmed from the ice, from a helicopter, and from aboard the two ships, this film captures the natural drama of the journey as the ships batter and buck their way through the heavy sea ice.
